column4: Hi. How can I enable my laptop to accept remote ssh requests? (I mean, set up my box as a remote server for others).
edit /etc/ssh/sshd_config
it is pretty self-explanatory
then start the ssh server with the command /etc/init.d/sshd start'
let me do that...
did you look over the config file?
I am looking at it, but I'm kinda' lost... what should I look for?
RhostsRSAAuthentication yes, perhaps?
it will work out of the box. When you have time, take a look at searcher.myvnc.com/geek ... I have some notes about what I did regarding remote access. For now....let it remain as is
leave the config file, and start the server with '/etc/init.d/sshd start'
/etc/init.d/sshd doesn't seem to exist.
did you install openssh-server?
/etc/init.d/ssh start perhaps?
yep.
oops...wait a sec....I run both ubuntu and suse...and might have confused them again <argh>
it is a command /usr/sbin/sshd start ... sorry
you will need sudo with that
trying to follow two at once is going to get confusing....you two work on it
'Extra argument start'.
check 'ps ax | grep sshd'...see if it is running
ok...it is up and running...try to access it
how do I get the 'good' IP then?
